intro: Pandaca mocquerysi var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved pandaca, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and drawing moisture and nutrients from the air. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
